articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as England play Pakistan in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: England bat first against Pakistan in final group game

articles.description: Liam Lindsay heads in a Preston winner in the final minute in the Lancashire derby at Blackburn.
articles.title: Preston earn 90th-minute derby win at Blackburn

articles.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta warns Aaron Ramsdale not to rush any decision over his future after falling out of favour this season.
articles.title: Arteta warns Ramsdale not to rush decision on future

articles.description: Rassie van der Dussen hits an unbeaten 76 to take South Africa to a nervy five-wicket win over Afghanistan.
articles.title: Van der Dussen guides South Africa past Afghanistan

articles.description: Briton Tom Aspinall aims to become UFC interim champion on Saturday and here are predictions for the heavyweight contest.
articles.title: Aspinall v Pavlovich - big-fight predictions

articles.description: England opener Dawid Malan is caught by wicketkeeper Muhammad Rizwan on 31 after attempting to reverse-sweep Iftikhar Ahmed as Pakistan claim their first wicket of the match.
articles.title: Malan caught as he tries to reverse-sweep Iftikhar

articles.description: Bath turned around a thrilling West Country derby to beat Gloucester at a sold-out Kingsholm.
articles.title: Bath come from behind to beat Gloucester

articles.description: Listen to BBC Radio 5 Sports Extra commentary as Australia play Bangladesh in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: Listen: World Cup - Australia v Bangladesh

articles.description: Lionel Messi has "no doubt" that Inter Miami will secure more silverware after he extended his record for Ballon d'Or wins.
articles.title: Messi vows to win more trophies with Inter Miami

articles.description: South Africa's David Miller makes a meal of a catch, including hitting himself in the face with the ball, before holding on to remove Afghanistan's Rahmat Shah for 26 in their Cricket World Cup.
articles.title: 'He smashed himself in the face!' Miller takes juggling catch
